  Convert value to integer.

<!-- This file is automatically generated. Please edit the command in https://github.com/nushell/nushell instead. -->

# <code>{{ $frontmatter.title }}</code> for conversions

<div class='command-title'>{{ $frontmatter.conversions }}</div>

## Signature

```> into int {flags} ...rest```

## Flags

 -  `--radix, -r {number}`: radix of integer
 -  `--endian, -e {string}`: byte encode endian, available options: native(default), little, big

## Parameters

 -  `...rest`: for a data structure input, convert data at the given cell paths


## Input/output types:

| input          | output    |
| -------------- | --------- |
| binary         | int       |
| bool           | int       |
| datetime       | int       |
| duration       | int       |
| filesize       | int       |
| list\<any\>      | list\<int\> |
| list\<bool\>     | list\<int\> |
| list\<datetime\> | list\<int\> |
| list\<duration\> | list\<int\> |
| list\<filesize\> | list\<int\> |
| list\<number\>   | list\<int\> |
| list\<string\>   | list\<int\> |
| number         | int       |
| record         | record    |
| string         | int       |
| table          | table     |
## Examples

Convert string to integer in table
```nu
> [[num]; ['-5'] [4] [1.5]] | into int num

```

Convert string to integer
```nu
> '2' | into int
2
```

Convert float to integer
```nu
> 5.9 | into int
5
```

Convert decimal string to integer
```nu
> '5.9' | into int
5
```

Convert file size to integer
```nu
> 4KB | into int
4000
```

Convert bool to integer
```nu
> [false, true] | into int
╭───┬───╮
│ 0 │ 0 │
│ 1 │ 1 │
╰───┴───╯

```

Convert date to integer (Unix nanosecond timestamp)
```nu
> 1983-04-13T12:09:14.123456789-05:00 | into int
419101754123456789
```

Convert to integer from binary
```nu
> '1101' | into int -r 2
13
```

Convert to integer from hex
```nu
> 'FF' |  into int -r 16
255
```

Convert octal string to integer
```nu
> '0o10132' | into int
4186
```

Convert 0 padded string to integer
```nu
> '0010132' | into int
10132
```

Convert 0 padded string to integer with radix
```nu
> '0010132' | into int -r 8
4186
```
